candidates.title: Run wasm-bindgen in CI and update parking_lot
candidates.body:
On current `master`, `wasm-bindgen` fails with:

> error: cannot import from modules (`env`) with `--no-modules`

`git bisect` lead me to https://github.com/emilk/egui/pull/1282 and a lot of `wasm2wat | rg` lead me to figure out it was because of https://github.com/Amanieu/parking_lot/issues/269

The fix is easy (update to `parking_lot 0.12`) but I would like the CI to find these problems earlier next time. Hence this PR.

candidates.title: Update crates
candidates.body: Skipping parking_lot for now because glutin is still using the old version anyway

candidates.title: Introduce egui_extras with RetainedImage for loading svg,png,jpeg,…
candidates.body:
This adds the new crate `egui_extras` that is meant for things that don't quite fit into `egui` proper, either because it is experimental, or because it uses dependencies that does not belong in `egui`.

In this initial PR only one thing is added to `egui_extras`: `RetainedImage`. This is an easy way to load images (once you have them in memory). It supports anything [the `image` crate](https://crates.io/crates/image) supports, plus SVG files.

candidates.title: Add web location info to egui_web/epi
candidates.body:
This adds all parts of the web "location" (URL) to `frame.info().web_info`, included a `HashMap` of the query parameters, percent-decoded and ready to go.

This lets you easily pass key-value pairs to your eframe web app.

candidates.title: feat: don't install console panic hook and tracing wasm subscriber by default
candidates.body: This resolves #1229.

candidates.title: Add an example of how to display an SVG image in egui
candidates.body:
This uses `resvg`, `tiny-skia`, `usvg` to load and rasterize an SVG so it can be shown in egui.

This success followed two false starts:

* Using lyon and vector-graphics: https://gist.github.com/emilk/77271e69c50b7bffc018af47835c11af
* Using `nsvg`: https://gist.github.com/emilk/455ac28ce9d7178f280204d26515bbc0

candidates.title: cargo deny: clarify MPL-2.0 license and use un-patched ureq again
candidates.body: See https://github.com/algesten/ureq/issues/478#issuecomment-1031029647

candidates.title: Run cargo deny in CI
candidates.body:
[`cargo-deny`](https://github.com/EmbarkStudios/cargo-deny) is a wonderful tool, so let's use it!

This lead me to two copy-left problems:
* https://github.com/ndarilek/tts-rs/pull/21
* https://github.com/algesten/ureq/pull/479

candidates.title: Use tracing crate for logging
candidates.body:
This adds the `tracing` crate to `egui_web`, `egui_glow` and `egui-winit`. `egui` gets it as an opt-in dependency. It is used for logging.

In `egui_web` the logs will automatically end up in the dev console. For native, app developers must add `tracing-subscriber = "0.3"` to their `Cargo.toml` and then add `tracing_subscriber::fmt::init();` to their `fn main` in order to get logs to `stdout`. Even then, the egui crates log very little, so you may not see anything logged unless you run with `RUST_LOG=debug`.

candidates.title: Re-enable window transparency
candidates.body:
- `winit` 0.26.1 fixes the crash on Windows 11
- Cargo.lock was updated with `cargo update`

`winit` version was checked with:

```
$ cargo tree -p winit --depth 0
winit v0.26.1
```

candidates.title: Texture loading in egui
candidates.body:
This continues https://github.com/emilk/egui/pull/999 by moving texture allocation from `epi` into `egui` proper.

With this PR you can convert an image into a texture using `egui::Context::load_texture`. This returns an `egui::TextureHandle` which can be used with e.g. `ui.image(…)`. The `TextureHandle` uses ref-counting, and when the last `TextureHandle` is dropped, the texture is freed. This makes it far more ergonomic and convenient to show images in `egui`.

Here is an example of how to use it: https://github.com/emilk/egui/blob/master/eframe/examples/image.rs

Backend integrations need to adapt by handling the new `epaint::TexturesDelta` each frame, a struct that specifies what textures were loaded and freed each frame.

candidates.title: egui_glow: Reduce memory allocations in Painter::set_texture
candidates.body: Use `bytemuck::cast_slice` to cast `image.pixels`. Thanks @emilk for this solution.

candidates.title: egui-winit: Automatically detect and apply dark or light mode
candidates.body:
Closes https://github.com/emilk/egui/issues/1001

Uses the `dark-light` crate: https://crates.io/crates/dark-light

candidates.title: Faster dashed line generation
Use `instant` crate in egui-winit for WebAssembly support
candidates.body:
<!--
Please read the "Making a PR" section of [`CONTRIBUTING.md`](https://github.com/emilk/egui/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md) before opening a Pull Request!

* Keep your PR:s small and focused.
* If applicable, add a screenshot or gif.
* Unless this is a trivial change, add a line to the relevant `CHANGELOG.md` under "Unreleased".
* If it is a non-trivial addition, consider adding a demo for it to `egui_demo_lib`.
* Remember to run `cargo fmt` and `cargo clippy`.
* Open the PR as a draft until you have self-reviewed it and it is green.
* When you have addressed a PR comment, mark it as resolved.

Please be patient! I will review you PR, but my time is limited!
-->

Closes #1022.

candidates.title: Switch to using glow as the default renderer both on native and the web
candidates.body: Following https://github.com/emilk/egui/pull/685 by @AlexApps99 and https://github.com/emilk/egui/pull/868 by @t18b219k it is time to switch to using glow by default!

candidates.title: 0.16.1 patch release: Add back CtxRef::begin_frame/end_frame
candidates.body: `begin_frame`, `end_frame` is more convenient when using egui in a game engine. In particular, 0.16.0 was incompatible with <https://github.com/mvlabat/bevy_egui>.

candidates.title: Set MSRV to 1.56.0 and use rust edition 2021
candidates.body: I want to be able to use disjoint capture in closures!

candidates.title: Update winit to 0.26
candidates.body:
- This has some obvious issues at the moment. First, transparent windows are not working on Windows 11. See: https://github.com/rust-windowing/winit/issues/2082 So I've disabled that feature for now.
- Secondly, `glium` needs an update. I'm patching it with an unreleased git revision to make sure things are working together.

candidates.title: Fix wrong gamma in WebkitGTK
candidates.body:
Epiphany's incorrect sRGB handling  cause  same result as displaying linear image on other browsers.
I fixed this issue by double sRGB correcting in post process. 
Glitched image
![color difference](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48007646/140709974-c473cad4-17ff-4f24-8adf-fef2fe4232ef.png)
fixed result
![スクリーンショット 2021-11-08 174650](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/48007646/140711248-c00fcac3-fd18-443e-9ae4-e19089a7036c.png)
